quoteFirst: Mary O’Rourke tried to keep her out of play as much as possible, and in doing this weakened her side. Before the end of the second half East High scored again, and the score finally stood, when the whistle was blown to cease playing, at
quoteLast: in favor of the home team.
title: The Girls of Central High; Or, Rivals for All Honors
author: Morrison, Gertrude W.

quoteFirst: We didn’t do so badly the first half, but after that Broadwood got a goal on a fluke――Henry kicked the puck into his own goal――and that gave them a lead of two, and we went up in the air and played shinney all the rest of the game. At that they only licked us
quoteLast: ; or maybe it was eight to four; something like that. I hope to goodness we sock it to ’em good and hard this time, though. He evidently expects you to play goal in that game, Tucker.
title: Guarding His Goal
author: Barbour, Ralph Henry, 1870-1944; Avison, George, 1885-1970 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: But perhaps the vilest episode of all was the shooting of a whole family of hostages in Elizabetgrad during the May of 1920, when the four little daughters of an officer, children from
quoteLast: years old, were shot along with their grandmother of sixty-nine!
title: The red terror in Russia
author: Melʹgunov, S. P. (Sergeĭ Petrovich), 1879-1956; Hogarth, C. J. (Charles James), 1869-1942 [Translator]

quoteFirst: "Open the door, Boy Jack."  As soon as it was open, about twenty black children from
quoteLast: years old, most of them naked, with their ivory skins like a polished table, and quite pot-bellied from good living, tumbled into the room, to the great amusement of Newton and the party.  They were followed by seven or eight more, who were not yet old enough to walk; but they crawled upon all-fours almost as fast as the others, who could walk erect after the image of their Maker.
title: Newton Forster; Or, The Merchant Service
author: Marryat, Frederick, 1792-1848

quoteLast: --I was bending over her at the moment, studying her face for any sign of stirring consciousness--she quietly opened her eyes.
title: The Book of Susan: A Novel
author: Dodd, Lee Wilson, 1879-1933

quoteLast: ," muttered Roy as, drawing his big leather mitten on, he stepped to the base and held his hands out toward Kirby. "That's four to make up to tie them." _Sock_ came a ball against the hollow of his mitt.
title: The Crimson Sweater
author: Barbour, Ralph Henry, 1870-1944; Relyea, C. M. (Charles M.), 1863-1932 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: “In Cheshire, Middlesex, Somersetshire, and Surrey, in the year 1838, there were, respectively, _two_ commutations of the sentence for murder. The result was that in the first county the commitments, as between that year and the year following, fell from two to one; in the second county they fell from
quoteLast: ; in the third, from three to one; and in the fourth, from three to two; thus giving a diminution, respectively, of one-half, four-sevenths, two-thirds, and one-third.
title: Hans of Iceland, Vol. 2 of 2; The Last Day of a Condemned
author: Hugo, Victor, 1802-1885; Hesketh-Fleetwood, Peter, Sir, 1801-1866 [Contributor]

quoteLast: against him, managed to fight with tactical odds of four to three in his favor.
title: Captains of the Civil War: A Chronicle of the Blue and the Gray
author: Wood, William, 1864-1947

title:
